channel.title: William and Kate Marriage
channel.description:
If you've not heard, William proposed to her about a month ago in Africa, and the marriage is planned for sometime in the summer of 2011.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/europe/11/16/uk.royal.engagement.interview/index.html?hpt=C1
A video of Kates parents regarding the proposal:
http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/world/2010/11/16/sot.uk.kate.middleton.parents.ukpool
I find it funny that he's got to read it off a script, it seems like he should be able to recite what he's saying fairly well assuming they're true..

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It depends. There is enormous pressure on the Royal family as it is to keep everyone happy, including the government when it comes to spending, they don’t cost much at all. All sorts has been looked at in regards to the royal family over the few months of cuts, the queen hasn’t had a pay rise in over 20 years and with inflation… you know what i’m getting at.

As for Charles, he is alright now, maybe he’ll change when he becomes king, but I don’t know - that is for when he actually becomes king, but at the moment - I am fine with Charles.

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:38, topic:368982”]I’d be in line with you to, I wouldn’t visit for the monarch, but for the reasons you stated. But I know there is significant interest in them, for whatever reason, I don’t know.

My defence of the British monarch in general is because of the fact they cause no hassle to the public, the history of the British monarchy is long, and is such an important part of the country’s history, for both good and bad reasons that it’d be such a shame to get rid.[/quote]

You’ll be happy with Charles then? Same applies to the Netherlands. Our current queen isn’t all that bad, but our crown-prince is quite the feudal bastard. He is exploiting his position already, he wanted a holiday home in Mozambique. The house is being built under bad conditions. He decided to sell it, but only after complaints from the government.

But don’t you agree that in a time when there are so much cuts in government expenses, often damaging the weak, you could at least cut some expenses involving the monarchy?

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’d be in line with you to, I wouldn’t visit for the monarch, but for the reasons you stated. But I know there is significant interest in them, for whatever reason, I don’t know.

My defence of the British monarch in general is because of the fact they cause no hassle to the public, the history of the British monarchy is long, and is such an important part of the country’s history, for both good and bad reasons that it’d be such a shame to get rid.

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:35, topic:368982”]You don’t need a monarch for that? You’re right. But when such castles contain probably the most famous monarch in the world (currently), it adds to the package that attracts tourism to London. People don’t come just to see the Queen or Buckingham palace, but it is an extra incentive for some.

I’d love for you to name some other palaces in the UK, without googling it, that are popular tourist destinations. Or in fact any other castle.

As for figures, they crop up every now and again over the years and generally fall in favour of the cost covering the 69p per person, per year.[/quote]

tbh removing the monarch doesn’t mean removing all the castles and other would-be tourist attractions. In fact, I think removing the monarchy would make it more of a tourist attraction.

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ve been to Windsor castle myself. I’ve visited the Tower of London, which could be named a castle. I can’t think of any other castles without googling, but that doesn’t matter. I’ve only visited the UK twice, both times London only. Both were school trips, with a program based entirely on visiting places in London (and Windsor castle). I bet Scotland has nice palaces too.

But I’ve visited some castles and palaces in Germany, and it’s been a while since the last monarch in Germany was abolished. I visited those castles because they look great. The architecture, the gardens. Heck, I even visit ruins.

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

You don’t need a monarch for that? You’re right. But when such castles contain probably the most famous monarch in the world (currently), it adds to the package that attracts tourism to London. People don’t come just to see the Queen or Buckingham palace, but it is an extra incentive for some.

I’d love for you to name some other palaces in the UK, without googling it, that are popular tourist destinations. Or in fact any other castle.

As for figures, they crop up every now and again over the years and generally fall in favour of the cost covering the 69p per person, per year.

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:33, topic:368982”]I’m sure the 29 years between the last Royal wedding and this one has more than made up for it. Besides, the projected figures for tourism over the time going up and around that event still apply.

So, no.[/quote]

Just to tease: Do you have any sources that show a relation between your monarchy and tourism? Please don’t say that tourists visit castles and such, you don’t need a monarch for that.

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:368982”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=465111.msg3403782#msg3403782 date=1290172676]
I stand by my first statement when I first heard this news story.

“I don’t give a fuck.”

Seriously, it’s not news. I couldn’t care less about any sort of royal wedding. I have no respect for the royals and would rather we have no monarchy at all. Take there money away and pump it in to the system.
[/quote]

I completely agree with this. That was my first thought as well.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: William and Kate Marriage
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:21, topic:368982”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=465111.msg3407843#msg3407843 date=1290462413]

I stand by my first statement when I first heard this news story.

“I don’t give a fuck.”

Seriously, it’s not news. I couldn’t care less about any sort of royal wedding.

I completely agree with this.
[/quote]
This.

BUT

Take there money away and pump it in to the system.

I completely agree with this. That was my first thought as well.

Did you not see this:

[quote author=Thug-life link=topic=465111.msg3404509#msg3404509 date=1290217423]
The monarch in this country probably generates more money for the economy than we pay to them. It’d be more beneficial to keep them.
[/quote][/quote]

It’s not my country, so I really don’t care. My country said ‘fuck you’ to the british monarchy in the 1700s. I was mainly just agreeing with the first stuff, about it not being news at all.

Read full topic
